sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Peruvian President Pedro Castillo is impeached and his vice, Dina Buluarte, is sworn in amid a constitutional crisis in Lima.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin admits his Ukraine war could be drawn out over a long undefined period of time and that the use of nuclear warfare is simmering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Peru has a new president and its first female leader after ex-president Pedro Castillo was impeached by Congress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dina Boluarte, previously the vice president, was sworn in amid a constitutional crisis in Lima.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Earlier, Castillo had announced he was replacing Congress with an exceptional emergency government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Lawmakers prepared to debate an attempt to remove him from office. It was their third try since he came to office in July last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a last attempt to stay in power, Castillo declared he was going to rule by decree. Then the head of the Constitutional Court accused him of launching a coup d'etat and lawmakers went ahead and impeached him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Footage was then released showing Castillo signing papers with prosecutors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Police say he has since been arrested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Lawyers are investigating six cases against Pedro Castillo, most of them for alleged corruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some of his detractors took to the streets to celebrate his ousting. Castillo has been locked in a power struggle with Congress since the Attorney General filed a complaint accusing him of heading a criminal organization. He and his family and allies are accused of handing out public contracts in exchange for kickbacks. Ukrainian firefighters deal with the aftermath of Russian shelling in the eastern city of Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has admitted that his war in Ukraine could turn into a long-term process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And he has warned that the threat of nuclear war is growing, although he claimed Russia would never be the first to use the weapons. Our strategy for using them is namely as defense, as we consider weapons of mass destruction, nuclear weapons, as built around the so-called retaliatory strike. When we are hit, we strike back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The United States has responded by slamming what it's called Putin's loose talk on nuclear weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Any loose talk of nuclear weapons is absolutely irresponsible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It flies in the face of the very statement that Russia formally signed on to in January of this year in the context of the UN Security Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: January of this year in the context of the UN Security Council. It flies in the face of the statement that we've heard from Russian officials even in recent weeks, reaffirming that very simple principle about a nuclear war. Meanwhile, the UN is set to release its report on human rights violations in Ukraine. It documents the deaths of 441 civilians in three regions as possible war crimes. Some were killed as they cut firewood or shopped for food.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Iran has executed a prisoner convicted for crimes allegedly committed during the country's ongoing anti-government protests. It's the first death penalty carried out by Tehran related to the disturbances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Mohsen Shaqari was accused of blocking a street and attacking a member of the security forces in Tehran, according to Iranian state media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Activists warn that several others may also be put to death after Tehran promised to clamp down on the unrest, which it claims is orchestrated by foreign actors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Iran has been rocked by protests since the death in September of Masa Amini in police custody after she was detained for breaking strict Islamic dress codes in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: 25 people remain in detention in Germany on suspicion of plotting to overthrow the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Wednesday's arrests amount to one of the biggest anti-extremism operations in modern German history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: More details are coming to light as to what they had allegedly planned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This group that has been eliminated today distinguished themselves by having been well connected throughout the country, by precise plans about what they were about to do, the project has been indeed quite violence orientated they were considering killing people the plotters are said to include members of the extremist Reichsburg movement which has long been known by German police for having racist and anti-semitic conspiracy theories. Other suspects came from the QAnon movement, who believe their country is in the hands of a mythical deep state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A man named Heinrich XIII from an old aristocratic family is alleged to have been central to their plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Individuals were already earmarked to take over different portfolios, including a former member of the German Bundestag for the Justice one. In addition to this council which was to plan a new statehood in a new state structure there is according to our knowledge a military arm. Three thousand officers took part in 150 operations in Germany with two more people arrested in Austria and Italy. The operation appears to indicate the extent of an alleged terrorist threat from extremists but it's unclear how capable the group would have been in carrying out their plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Italy's world famous La Scala Opera House has opened its new season with the Russian piece Boris Godunov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But the performance has been dogged by controversy, with some arguing that it's inappropriate to show while Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Those attending saw it differently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainians are fantastic, brave and courageous people and we support them with whatever is necessary and as long as it takes. I think we should not allow that Putin is destroying culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Italian prime minister agreed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We don't have anything against the Russian people, Russian history or Russian culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have something against those who have made the political choice to invade a sovereign country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The two dimensions must be kept separated because they are two very different things and we must not mix them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Before the opera began, about 30 Ukrainians protested outside the theatre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian culture itself wasn't their target, but rather how President Vladimir Putin is using it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I did not come here to protest against culture, against opera, but this is a big problem now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Culture has become something like a weapon for Russians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is the way Ukrainians feel about it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They don't want to hear anything Russian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In response, Laskala's management has reiterated its support for Ukraine, holding a benefit concert for the country, which raised 400,000 euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Croatia is expected to fully integrate into the European Schengen area from January 1, 2023.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: However, this news raises concerns amongst its non-EU neighbors, such as Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They fear they will become even more isolated as Zagreb will have to harden its borders with them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There's a possibility that the controls could become sloppier and slow down the whole thing even more. I don't see things getting any better. The Croatian border police has been implementing all the legal procedures of the European Union since the day they entered the EU which is July the 1st 2013. That's why we won't witness any big crowds at the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Apart from potential worries of difficulties in crossing the borders, Bosnia and Herzegovina fears being left on its own and is concerned there could be challenging divisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The sense of isolation, the sense of gap between Bosnia and Herzegovina and Croatia is also going to increase and the current policy of the EU towards Bosnia and Herzegovina but also towards the region of Western Balkans is such that there is no hope that in foreseeable future of five to ten years with the current policy this gap is going to narrow in fact it's probably going to become much much wider meanwhile former Croatian foreign minister Vesna Pusic told Euronews that the extension of the EU external borders will bring improvements to the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is not an environment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This is consolidation of European territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: These countries are surrounded by European territory, territory of the European Union, and it really is a question of European security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This can never be isolated in the sense of building a wall, because actually it's surrounded by a European Union. The EU hopes that Croatia's full membership will help stabilize the western Balkan region. Croatia is set to find out if its application was accepted on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Croatia set to find out if its application was accepted on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: British customs workers have voted to strike at major airports over Christmas, threatening further holiday travel chaos for those entering and leaving the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Around 1,000 border force officials at passport control will walk out over a pay and jobs dispute from 23rd to 26th December and again between 28th and 31st. Gatwick, Heathrow, Manchester, Birmingham, Glasgow and Cardiff will all be hit by the strike, which is expected to affect hundreds of thousands of people planning to go on holiday.
